channel.title: poem on LS | Papermod
channel.description: Recent content in poem on LS | Papermod

item.title: On Kissing A Little Girl
item.description: A little meditation, with description, on what the title says.

item.title: The Seven Gifts
item.description: I gave my clear-eyed boy a star Of clematis from summer days That dwelt among the scented ways Of an old garden still and far: So that it lights his dreams with truth From that walled garden of my youth, I gave my clear-eyed boy a star. I gave my soft-haired boy a crown Of olives from the groves of Greece, That all life’s passions turn to peace For him, and perilous paths lead down

item.title: Beautiful Atrocity
item.description: A frank little pedo scene, with poetic sentiment and graphic imagery.

item.title: The Waning Of Love
item.description: I. To love thee brings me sadness, for I know each time the time will never come again, – that every moment brings the darker stain of riper manhood. Liker as we grow, Love stirs its wings, impatient to remain. II. Each night of such a love from such a love doth part thy forward-looking self. At each remove from boyhood thou art further from my love, though nearer to the knowledge of my heart.

item.title: To One Part of a Little Girl
item.description: Very short. Even if poetry is not your thing, give it a try - well, if pedo feelings are your thing!

item.title: To A Young Girl
item.description: A fiery glance has never yet betrayed. Hold the man’s heart in your unversed child’s fingers, draw the man’s streaming fire into the icy staterooms of your eyes! You are as certain of love as you are of the kingdom of heaven. He will give you his heart, a kingdom and all the flowers of spring, and you will give him the light veil of your longing that makes the distance blue.

item.title: On A Child-Bride's Wedding Night
item.description: Sentiments and imagery of an adult male's wedding night with his child-bride. Her age is left for guessing, but descriptions of her should be a good clue. Also, there is no hint of how this marriage could have come about, only that it has and that the man determines to enjoy it.

item.title: A Girl Of Pompeii
item.description: A public haunt they found her in: She lay asleep, a lovely child; The only thing left undefiled Where all things else bore taint of sin. Her supple outlines fixed in clay The universal law suspend, And turn Time’s chariot back, and blend A thousand years with yesterday. A sinless touch, austere yet warm, Around her girlish figures pressed, Caught the sweet imprint of her breast, And held her, surely clasped, from harm.

item.title: Ode to Caitlin
item.description: My first attempt at poetry. Please don't be too critical. It doesn't have to rhyme, right? It may seem clunky but I think the rhythm works out. It's not a story, but I'm hoping there's enough aesthetics in this - plus vile imagery - to keep everyone happy!

item.title: A Girl, Some Crayons
item.description: A girl, some crayons Head angled down Tilted to elongate the slope of the neck The sweet slope of the neck Ending in shoulders, divine And a softly rising chest I am drawn Pulled Sure as the pull of the Earth I am hypnotized A soft breath calls me back Eyes focused Crayon-fist staying in the lines Hair falling A few strands And then more Holy light radiates One finger, quick

item.title: Earth Goddess Child
item.description: Earth goddess child, spirit of moonlight wild Bless the earth with your footsteps, and more I beg Bless the starlight with your eyes reflecting, your glittering lights Hush the chaos with your soft-drumming heart Earth goddess child, incarnation of moonlight wild Heal an aching soul with your laughter singing, your murmuring magic Holy and sacred and sky-clad you shimmer, and glimmer and shine Goosebumps sprout in your winding wake The moonlight will come to worship you in your purring sleep

item.title: Succubus Child
item.description: Under the green rushes your heart beats like a pagan drum The shadows shape you by day Watch evening fall like a darkening cloak with murmur and hum Now comes the road and the way Clad but in the night-sky your pale limbs leap and flash in flight A call turns the wheels of your heart Rushing to unspoken wishes you come a fleshy dream in the night Aimed so true, an unerring dart

item.title: One
item.description: It is her forbidden fruit, That’s what I crave. Hidden so well between hairless lips of her sex. I continuously find myself lost, With no guide, searching anyway. She plays with me, Appearing in many guises Yet I continue on my quest, Even though at times, I’ve felt led astray. I strengthen with every step. Hoping to find those consummations, So fruitful with passion. Nourishing the vitality of my spirit,

item.title: Annie Died The Other Day
item.description: annie died the other day never was there such a lay - whom, among her dollies, dad first (‘don’t tell your mother’) had; making annie slightly bad but very wonderful in bed saints and satyrs, go your way youths and maidens: let us pray
